references.paper_title: Pointnet++: Deep hierarchical feature learning on point sets in a metric space
references.reason: This paper introduces PointNet++, a foundational deep learning architecture for processing point cloud data, which is heavily used and cited in this work as a basis for the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Gradient-based learning applied to document recognition
references.reason: This is a seminal paper in the field of convolutional neural networks (CNNs), providing the foundational theoretical basis for many 3D CNN architectures used in the field.

references.paper_title: Multilayer feedforward networks are universal approximators
references.reason: This paper proves the universal approximation theorem for multilayer perceptrons, providing theoretical justification for the use of neural networks in general and for this paper's universal approximation theorem for lp-norm Nets.

This paper introduces Lp-norm multiple kernel learning, which is directly relevant to the central idea of this paper: utilizing lp-norms for convolution operations, hence establishing the foundation for various Lp-norm techniques discussed here.

references.paper_title: Pointnet: Deep learning on point sets for 3d classification and segmentation
references.reason: This paper introduces PointNet, an earlier and influential work on point cloud processing that is used as a baseline for evaluating the proposed method in this paper.
